title: What is Impossible Foods' meat made of? - Quora

response.answer_text: Impossible Foods relies on 2 key ingredients that makes their meat similar to the real stuff… Soybeans… (well, Soy Protein in particular)…  (from 123RF[1] ) … and Heme derived from those same specially GMO designed soybeans.  (from NPR.org) There’s loads of other ingredients, but these two are the most important. The Soybean itself, of course, is what makes the main “body” of the meat. The Leghemoblobin “Heme” is what gives the meat the beef like “bloody” taste. As for all the rest, here’s the label from the new Impossible “meat” packs that you can now find in the supermarket. I’m wondering if something giving 23.5x your daily needed Thiamin is safe, but it was FDA approved so I’ll just assume it is until I can check on that.  (from the Genetic Literacy Project) Footnotes[1] Redirect Notice
